sentences.sContent: John and I sat up until the early hours chatting.
sentences.sCn: 我和约翰聊到凌晨才睡。

sentences.sContent: ...The assumption is that children shouldn't chat in the classroom because it hinders hard work; instead...
...I relax with a good book or chat with friends or even have a game of bridge...
...blogs and chat rooms and so on are more widely used...
...more and more people like to chat on the Internet...
...we can chat with others where there is Internet with our tools such as computers...
...turn on her laptop and chat on Internet dating sites and instant-messaging programs – leaving her bed for only brief intervals...
...people are e-mailing friends and relatives all the time -- or talking to them in writing in online chat rooms...

phrases.pCn: n. （电视或广播电台的）访谈节目

words.tran: 饶舌的；爱讲闲话的；非正式的

trans.tranOther: to talk in a friendly informal way, especially about things that are not important
